moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 d5 4. cxd5 exd5 5. Bg5 Nbd7 6. e3 Be7 7. Bd3 O-O 8. Nge2 Re8 9. Qc2 c6 10. h3 Ne4 11. Bf4
comment: Refusing to exchange pieces on black's terms. 9...Ne4 looks silly as white can push through f2-f3, etc. with tempo.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 d5 4. cxd5 exd5 5. Bg5 Nbd7 6. e3 Be7 7. Bd3 O-O 8. Nge2 Re8 9. Qc2 c6 10. h3 Ne4 11. Bf4 Ndf6 12. f3 Nxc3 13. bxc3 Bd6 14. Bxd6 Qxd6 15. e4 Nh5
comment: Black's N is badly misplaced on h5.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 d5 4. cxd5 exd5 5. Bg5 Nbd7 6. e3 Be7 7. Bd3 O-O 8. Nge2 Re8 9. Qc2 c6 10. h3 Ne4 11. Bf4 Ndf6 12. f3 Nxc3 13. bxc3 Bd6 14. Bxd6 Qxd6 15. e4 Nh5 16. e5 Qh6 17. Qd2
comment: It might seem unnatural to exchange queens, since white's main idea is a pawn advanve en masse on the kingside.  The main point is to keep the initiative by harrasing black's knight. Meanwhile, white connects rooks and increases his lead in development.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 d5 4. cxd5 exd5 5. Bg5 Nbd7 6. e3 Be7 7. Bd3 O-O 8. Nge2 Re8 9. Qc2 c6 10. h3 Ne4 11. Bf4 Ndf6 12. f3 Nxc3 13. bxc3 Bd6 14. Bxd6 Qxd6 15. e4 Nh5 16. e5 Qh6 17. Qd2 Qxd2+ 18. Kxd2
comment: g4 is a threat, winning a piece.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 d5 4. cxd5 exd5 5. Bg5 Nbd7 6. e3 Be7 7. Bd3 O-O 8. Nge2 Re8 9. Qc2 c6 10. h3 Ne4 11. Bf4 Ndf6 12. f3 Nxc3 13. bxc3 Bd6 14. Bxd6 Qxd6 15. e4 Nh5 16. e5 Qh6 17. Qd2 Qxd2+ 18. Kxd2 g6 19. g4 Ng7 20. h4 h6
comment: To keep the kingside closed as long as possible.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 d5 4. cxd5 exd5 5. Bg5 Nbd7 6. e3 Be7 7. Bd3 O-O 8. Nge2 Re8 9. Qc2 c6 10. h3 Ne4 11. Bf4 Ndf6 12. f3 Nxc3 13. bxc3 Bd6 14. Bxd6 Qxd6 15. e4 Nh5 16. e5 Qh6 17. Qd2 Qxd2+ 18. Kxd2 g6 19. g4 Ng7 20. h4 h6 21. Raf1 Bd7 22. Rhg1 b5 23. f4 a5 24. f5
comment: Everything has been well prepared, and besides the obvious 25.fxg6 white also threatens 25.e6 fxe6 26. f6. Black is basically forced to commit suicide by opening the g-file.
